result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher M Kimpel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED. With Huber, standard release.

IF REVOKED: 25 days credit
Concurrent with: count 3
Court will allow early termination after 12 months if Agent deems appropriate.

miscConds.notes: Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of probation.If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol, controlled substances w/out a valid prescription, or drug paraphernalia.
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. 
Provide DNA sample if not already done/or provided.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 3:41 p.m.
Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by Attorney Wittchow.
Attorney Jeffrey Jensen appeared in court on behalf of Christopher Kimpel.
Christopher Kimpel appeared in court in custody.
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Count 1 is to be dismissed and read-in.
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Counts 2 and 3.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Counts 2 and 3.
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statements.

COUNT 2
Court orders the following:
6 MONTHS HUBER (standard release conditions)
Credit time 25-days, if Revoked
Sentence to run Concurrent to Count 3
SENTENCE IS STAYED.

Term of Probation:  18 Months
Court will allow early termination after 12 months if agent deems appropriate.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended
Absolute Sobriety, Random U.A.'s
No Use of Possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid RX, or drug paraphernalia
Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
Full-Time employment and/or combination of schooling

COSTS:  $243.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

COUNT 3
Court orders the following:
6 MONTHS HUBER (standard release conditions)
Sentence to run Concurrent to Count 2
SENTENCE IS STAYED.

Term of Probation:  18 Months
Court will allow early termination after 12 months if agent deems appropriate.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended
Absolute Sobriety, Random U.A.'s
No Use of Possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid RX, or drug paraphernalia
Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
Full-Time employment and/or combination of schooling

COSTS:  $243.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

10:14 AM Defendant Christopher M Kimpel in court, in custody, with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.   Alyssa M Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant waives his rght to a Preliminary Hearing.
